citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
1. A scientific staff member who is a voting member of the IACUC is also listed on IACUC protocol #1202. That individual
participated in a vote regarding the protocol at the IACUC meeting held in November 2023. However, since this individual
is also listed on the protocol she should not have participated in the review or approval process, as she has a conflict of
interest.
Allowing individuals with a conflict of interest to participate in the review and approval process compromises the ability of
the IACUC to ensure optimal animal welfare and the judicious use of animals in study activities. Correct by ensuring that
no member contributes to a quorum nor participates in an IACUC review or approval of an activity in which that member
has a conflicting interest (e.g., is personally involved in the activity), except to provide information requested by the
IACUC.
2. The written narrative of the methods and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available to potentially
painful or distressful procedures is not included in the IACUC approved Protocol #1202 proposal for animal use.
The IACUC should determine during the review of animal use protocols that the proposed activities meet all of the
requirements as per Section 2.31 (d) that includes the consideration of alternatives by the investigator to the potentially
painful or distressful procedures described in the proposal for animal use.
The IACUC needs to ensure that all active proposals including AWA covered species are in compliance with Section 2.31
(d).
******Correct by May 1, 2024 and for all future IACUC meetings.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
IACUC approved protocol #1202 did not contain a complete description of several aspects of the proposed use of
animals. A compete description is required in order to ensure that the IACUC is able to properly assess the animal use.
The protocol must be updated to include the required information and subsequently approved by the IACUC.
*********Correct the during next IACUC meeting or by May 1, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
TONYA HADJIS n

narrative:
2.31(d) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
1. A scientific staff member who is a voting member of the IACUC is also listed on IACUC protocol #1202. That individual 
participated in a vote regarding the protocol at the IACUC meeting held in November 2023. However, since this individual 
is also listed on the protocol she should not have participated in the review or approval process, as she has a conflict of 
interest. 
 
Allowing individuals with a conflict of interest to participate in the review and approval process compromises the ability of 
the IACUC to ensure optimal animal welfare and the judicious use of animals in study activities. Correct by ensuring that 
no member contributes to a quorum nor participates in an IACUC review or approval of an activity in which that member 
has a conflicting interest (e.g., is personally involved in the activity), except to provide information requested by the 
IACUC.  
 
2. The written narrative of the methods and sources used to determine that alternatives were not available to potentially 
painful or distressful procedures is not included in the IACUC approved Protocol #1202 proposal for animal use.  
 
The IACUC should determine during the review of animal use protocols that the proposed activities meet all of the 
requirements as per Section 2.31 (d) that includes the consideration of alternatives by the investigator to the potentially 
painful or distressful procedures described in the proposal for animal use. 
 
The IACUC needs to ensure that all active proposals including AWA covered species are in compliance with Section 2.31 
(d). 
 
******Correct by May 1, 2024 and for all future IACUC meetings. 
2.31(e)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
IACUC approved protocol #1202 did not contain a complete description of several aspects of the proposed use of 
animals. A compete description is required in order to ensure that the IACUC is able to properly assess the animal use.

The protocol must be updated to include the required information and subsequently approved by the IACUC. 
*********Correct the during next IACUC meeting or by May 1, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
TONYA HADJIS n
